content.description: Follow bolts up the pretty face with some delicate trickery and inobvious hand sequence(s) to ledge at about 40'. Head right to clip next bolt then up slabby face (protect seams...required some gardening but should continue to clean up nicely) at a much easier grade than the face below.
content.protection: Small stuff. Blue TCU, HB offsets & 6 bolts.  Rap from shuts.
content.location:
This is 5' right of

Sweaty Betty

.

content.description: Delicate starting sequence. Staying in the direct line (not trending left of bolt line) is way more fun!, leads to gear (mid size cam on an extendo sling) protected overlap at middle. Steep and fun/pumpy "headwall" finishes off the affair!
content.protection: 5 bolts (cam(s) at center overlap). Chain anchor.
content.location: On the west-facing (hiker's right) side of the Phat City Wall.

content.description: Pass an uninspiring start with a couple of cam placements to get to the upper panel. Navigate the headwall past 3 bolts to the anchors.
content.protection: 3 bolts and some finger to maybe hand-sized cams.
content.location:
This is left of

Candy Apple Red

and

Sunburst

, on the upper, rightmost section of Phat City.

content.description:
Some harder-than-it-looks climbing on some cripsy holds past two bolts gains a cool jug/mantel to a ledge. The crux begins abruptly above the fourth bolt (keep your eyes open for some sneaky beta that keeps the rating at .11d). Make sure you have an attentive belay, as the fifth clip is rather strenuousâ€”blowing it with slack out could drop you near, or onto the ledge below. The sixth bolt is hidden at the lip of another ledge, where you can rest as long as you want before making some fun moves past the final bolt to the anchor, which is about 8 feet right of a small tree in the middle of the cliff.

This is probably the best line at the crag, as it tackles the middle, cleanest part of the wall and is more sustained than

Brown Sugar

.
content.location:
It is in the middle of the main cliff immediately right of

Brown Sugar

.

content.description: Long route (do it in a single pitch. Use mid anchor to rap w/ single rope). Textbook cam protects the initial blocky roof (I thought this was the crux...my partner thought otherwise...lemme know). Varied climbing follows up to the super fun, upper slab! Great protection and a (rarity for the pass) pretty long route conspire to make this entirely worth the effort!
content.protection: Rack to 2". Several small Aliens. 7 bolts.
content.location: This is on the left side of Phat City.

content.description: Start up an overhanging dihedral, go to a ledgy section, then finish up on kind of a prow, staying slightly right.
content.location:
It is just left of

Candy Apple Red

.

content.description: This climbs up an arete on the right side of Phat City Wall.
content.protection: 2 bolts and small cams to chains.
content.location: This is on the right side of wall uphill.

content.description: Climb a broken crack using small gear to chains.
content.location:
This is to the left of

Phat Free Arete

(shares chains).

content.description: This has varied climbing on solid stone.  Great position!
content.location:
This is just left of

Treeline

.

content.description: This is the farthest rightmost bolted route at Phat City.  It is long and thought-provoking for the grade, ascending a a series of roofs and sharp edges with a sequence that initially appears devious.
content.protection: 9 bolts to a 2-bolt anchor.  1 or 2 runners may be useful to reduce rope drag, but be careful of sharp edges.  One or two key bolts are placed in such a way to minimize risk of the rope being cut, at the expense of additional drag.
